class thirdai.dataset.Explanation

Bases: pybind11_object

Represents an input column that is responsible for a predicted outcome.

__annotations__ = {}
__init__(*args, **kwargs)
__module__ = 'thirdai._thirdai.dataset'
__repr__(self: thirdai._thirdai.dataset.Explanation) → str
__str__(self: thirdai._thirdai.dataset.Explanation) → str
property column_name

Identifies the responsible input column.

property keyword

A brief description of the value in this column.

property percentage_significance

The column’s contribution to the predicted outcome. Can be positive or negative depending on the relationship between the responsible column and the prediction. For example, it can be negative if the responsible input column and the prediction are negatively correlated.

thirdai.dataset.bolt_tokenizer(sentence: str, dimension: int = 100000) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray[numpy.uint32], numpy.ndarray[numpy.uint32]]

Utility that turns a sentence into a sequence of token embeddings. To be used for text classification tasks. :param * sentence: String - Sentence to be tokenized. :param * dimensions: Int (positive) - (Optional) The dimension of each token embedding. Defaults to 100,000.

thirdai.dataset.from_numpy(data: object, batch_size: int = None) → thirdai._thirdai.dataset.BoltDataset
thirdai.dataset.load_bolt_svm_dataset(*args, **kwargs)

Overloaded function.

  1. load_bolt_svm_dataset(filename: str, batch_size: int, softmax_for_multiclass: bool = True) -> Tuple[thirdai._thirdai.dataset.BoltDataset, thirdai._thirdai.dataset.BoltDataset]

Loads a BoltDataset from an SVM file. Each line in the input file represents a sparse input vector and should follow this format: ` l_0,l_1,...,l_m i_0:v_0 i_1:v_1 ...     i_n:v_n ` where l_0,l_1,…,l_m is an arbitrary number of categorical labels (integers only), and each i:v is an index-value pair representing a non-zero element in the vector. There can be an arbitrary number of these index-value pairs.

Parameters

  • filename (*) – String - Path to input file.

  • batch_size (*) – Int (positive) - Size of each batch in the dataset.

  • softmax_for_multiclass (*) – Bool (default is true) - Multi-label samples must be processed slightly differently if softmax is being used in the output layer instead of sigmoid. When this flag is true the loader will process samples with multiple labels assuming that softmax and CategoricalCrossEntropy are being used for multi-label datasets. If the dataset is single label, then this argument has no effect.

Returns a tuple containing a BoltDataset to store the data itself, and a BoltDataset storing the labels.

  1. load_bolt_svm_dataset(data_loader: thirdai._thirdai.dataset.DataLoader, softmax_for_multiclass: bool = True) -> Tuple[thirdai._thirdai.dataset.BoltDataset, thirdai._thirdai.dataset.BoltDataset]

The same as the other implementation of this method, but takes in a custom data loader instead of a file name.

thirdai.dataset.load_click_through_dataset(filename: str, batch_size: int, max_num_numerical_features: int, max_categorical_features: int, delimiter: str = '\t') → Tuple[thirdai::dataset::InMemoryDataset<thirdai::BoltBatch>, thirdai::dataset::InMemoryDataset<thirdai::BoltBatch>, thirdai::dataset::InMemoryDataset<thirdai::BoltBatch>]

Loads a Clickthrough dataset from a file. To be used with DLRM. Each line of the input file should follow this format: ` l       d_1     d_2     ...     d_m     c_1     c_2     ...     c_n` where l is the label, d is a numerical (quantitative) feature, m is the expected number of numerical features, c is a categorical feature (integer only), and n is the expected number of categorical features.

Parameters

  • filename (*) – String - Path to input file.

  • batch_size (*) – Int (positive) - Size of each batch in the dataset.

  • num_numerical_features (*) – Int (positive) - Number of expected numerical features in each dataset.

  • max_categorical_features (*) – Int (positive) - Maximum number of expected categorical features in each dataset.

Returns a tuple containing a BoltDataset, BoltTokenDataset to store the dense and categorical features, and a BoltDataset storing the labels.

thirdai.dataset.make_dense_vector(values: List[float]) → thirdai._thirdai.dataset.BoltVector
thirdai.dataset.make_sparse_vector(indices: List[int], values: List[float]) → thirdai._thirdai.dataset.BoltVector
thirdai.dataset.tokenize_to_svm(input_file, output_dim=100000, output_file='preprocessed_data.svm')

Utility function that converts text datasets into vector representations, saves them in SVM format.

Parameters

  • input_file (*) – String - Path to a text dataset. More on this below.

  • output_dim (*) – Int (positive, optional) - The dimension of the vector representations

  • 100 (produced by this function. Defaults to) –

  • 000. –

  • output_file (*) – String - Path to a file where we save the vector representations.

  • ./preprocessed_data.svm (Defaults to) –

Text dataset format

The text dataset must be a CSV file where each row follows this format:

<pos or neg>,<text>

For example, we can have a training corpus called example_train.csv that contains the following:

```

pos,Had a great time at the webinar.

neg,I hate slow deep learning models.

```
